pages.title: ⤝ Ten of Swords ⤝
pages.text: Spirit of Ruin$(br)      ☉ Sun in ♊ Gemini

A prone figure, pierced by all the swords belonging to the card.$(br)  Dark clouds hovering above signify despair and a bleak situation.$(br)  However, there is hope in spite of the situation; the golden sky in the distance suggests that the darkest of night is over and a new day dawns.$(br)  We need to move forward with life, even if it causes initial pain and hurt, rather than falling down in a heap hoping

someone will take pity on us.$(br)  That requires us to experience the full impact of what has happened before we can move on.$(br)  We can look at this card as a shocking end of a struggle, or a sudden loss.$(br)  We may also look at it as transcendence. The mind gives us the ability to transcend pain through the act of contemplating the bigger picture.

$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Affliction, sadness, desolation.$(br)  Abstraction, detachment from emotion or habitual worries.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Confusion, a flawed vision of advantage.$(br)  Becoming distracted by worry or responsibility.
